PokerProject

Class Game

  • Object
    • Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VideoPoker
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Debug, Interactive, Simulation

    public abstract class Game
extends Object
implements VideoPoker
    Class Game implements Interface VideoPoker and it represents the core functioning of the Video Poker.

    Each object has four main attributes:

    • user - variable of type Player that represents the player of the game;
    • data - variable of type Statistics for analysis of the performance of the player in the game;
    • deck - variable of type Deck that corresponds to the deck of cards used for playing;
    • tableDB - variable of type Variants that corresponds to the information (database) from the variant of Video Poker being used.

    And also five attributes for the functioning of the game:

    • betValue - variable of type Integer that represents the value the player is betting in a move;
    • checkbet - variable of type boolean for checking if a bet was done;
    • checkdeal - variable of type boolean for checking if a deal was done;
    • checkhold - variable of type boolean for checking if a hold was done;
    • inputPlay - array of type Character that contains the commands to do the moves ($ - credit, a -advice, b - bet, s - statistics, d - deal, h - hold).

    Note that this class is abstract since the method play() is only implemented in the subclasses.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(int initMoney,
            Variants optionTable)
        Constructor specifying the initial balance of the player and the Variants of Video Poker being used. Note that the Statistics variable's initialization is dependent on the variant being used since the possible winning hands change. The boolean variables are initialized as FALSE, except checkhold because it corresponds to the beginning of the game.
        Parameters:
        initMoney - initial balance of the player when starting the game.
        optionTable - variant of Video Poker used in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • setBetValue

        public void setBetValue(int newValue)
        Sets the current value of the bet (betValue).
        Parameters:
        newValue - new betting value.

      • getBetValue

        public int getBetValue()
        Gets the current value of the bet (betValue).
        Returns:
        betting value.

      • doCredit

        public void doCredit()
        When asked for the credit of the player (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a message with the user credit's is printed in the terminal. It is possible to ask for the credit at any time of the game. Note that an error message is printed in case of illegal command input.
        Specified by:
        doCredit in interface VideoPoker

      • doStatistics

        public void doStatistics()
        When asked for the statistics of the game (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a table with statistics is printed in the terminal. It is possible to ask for the statistics at any time of the game. Note that an error message is printed in case of illegal command input.
        Specified by:
        doStatistics in interface VideoPoker

      • doBet

        public void doBet()
        When asked for betting during the game (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a message with the value of the bet is printed in the terminal. In case the bet command does not include the value, the previous bet value is used or, if it is the first move, 5 value is used. If a value is included that value must be between 1 and 5. It is checked if the player has enough money to bet. It is possible to ask for the betting only at the beginning of a new move. This means that the checkhold must be true. Note that an error message is printed in case of illegal command input.
        Specified by:
        doBet in interface VideoPoker

      • doHold

        public void doHold()
        When asked for the holding cards (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a message with the final hand is printed in the terminal, as well as the evaluation of the final hand (if the player won or lost). The hold command is followed by the indexes of the cards the player wants to hold (example: "h 1 3" means that the player wants to hold the first and the third cards counting from left to right). If the hold command does not include any indexes, it means that the player wants all cards new. The indexes must be between 1 and 5. It is possible to ask for holding only after dealing (give the initial five cards). This means that the checkdeal must be true. Note that an error message is printed in case of illegal command input.
        Specified by:
        doHold in interface VideoPoker

      • doAdvice

        public void doAdvice()
        When asked for advice of what cards to hold (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a message with the suggestion of the indexes is printed in the terminal. It is possible to ask for advice only after dealing (give the initial five cards). This means that the checkdeal must be true. Note that an error message is printed in case of illegal command input.
        Specified by:
        doAdvice in interface VideoPoker

      • doEvaluation

        public void doEvaluation()
        After holding cards, the evaluation of the final hand is done and (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a message saying if the player won or lost is printed in the terminal. The method evaluation from Variants if used to determine the result of the final hand. The number of deals is incremented in the data as well as the array incNbHands. In case of winning, the credit of the player is incremented by the value won.
        Specified by:
        doEvaluation in interface VideoPoker

      • play

        public abstract void play()
                   throws IOException
        Play the game in a specific mode. Since it is specific for each mode, it is abstract in the superclass and only implemented in the subclasses.
        Specified by:
        play in interface VideoPoker
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while reading inputs.
